pageContext.claim: “In Wisconsin, there are approximately 70,000 absentee ballots that do not have matching ballot applications as required by law.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump meant to say 170,000, not 70,000. But this is still poppycock. "That group of in-person absentee voters did indeed fill out an application in order to cast their ballot. It was part of the ballot certificate on the envelope, but that doesn't make it any less valid since state statute doesn’t specify the nature of that application," said PolitiFact in a "Pants on Fire" ruling. "It’s the same approach that’s been used without issue in Wisconsin elections since 2010 — including the 2016 presidential contest that Trump won."
